params.name: _id
params.doc: Order ID.

params.name: effectiveAt
params.doc:
When the order is canceled.

One time orders can only be canceled immediately. Supported values:
- `"IMMEDIATELY"`: The order is canceled immediately.
- `"NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE"`: The order is canceled at the next payment date.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the order is canceled.

description:
The `cancelOrder()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the order is successfully canceled.

For orders with recurring payments, a cancellation can be set to occur either `IMMEDIATELY` or at the `NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE`.
For orders with one-time payments, a cancellation occurs `IMMEDIATELY`.

Canceling an order changes the order status to `CANCELED`.

#### Canceling during the free trial period.

When a buyer cancels their order during the free trial period, the buyer's subscription expires at the end of the free trial period and they won't be billed. The buyer may continue using the benefits until the end of the free trial period.

When a site owner cancels an ordered plan during the free trial period, they choose to apply the cancellation `IMMEDIATELY` or at the `NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE`.

Canceling `IMMEDIATELY` will end the subscription for the buyer
immediately, even during the free trial period and the buyer won't be billed.
Canceling at the `NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE` allows the buyer to continue using the benefits of the subscription until the end of the free trial period. Then, the subscription ends and the buyer is not billed.

docs.summary: Creates an order for a buyer who purchased the plan with an offline transaction.
description:
The `createOfflineOrder()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an `order` object when the order has been created.

Payment of an offline order is handled in 1 of 2 ways.
- When creating the order, select `true` in the `paid` request parameter.
- After creation, with the [`markAsPaid()`](#markaspaid) function.

When creating a non-free offline order:
- The order's status is set to `"PENDING"` if the start date is in the future. Otherwise, the status is set to `"ACTIVE"`.
The order's last payment status is set to `"UNPAID"` or `"PAID"`.

When creating a free offline order:
- The order's status is set to `"PENDING"` if the start date is in the future. Otherwise, the status is set to `"ACTIVE"`.
- The order's last payment status is set to `"NOT_APPLICABLE"`.

params.name: planId
params.doc: ID of the plan of the previewed order.

params.name: memberId
params.doc: Member ID of the buyer the previewed order is for.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for previewing the offline order.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - A preview of the order.

docs.summary: Provides a preview of an offline order as if it was purchased.
description:
The `getOfflineOrderPreview()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a temporary preview of the offline order.

The preview uses the same logic as purchasing a plan, but the preview is not saved. Because an order is not actually created, the preview's `_id` and `subscriptionId` properties are displayed as a string of multiple zero characters (`000000-0000`).

If [taxes are configured](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-setting-up-tax-collection) for the site, taxes are applied to the preview. If not, `tax` previews as `null`.

You can preview the order to check purchase limitations, but the limitations are not enforced for the preview. If a pricing plan has a limit on the amount of purchases per buyer, that limit is not considered for generating the preview. But, if that limit has been reached and this order would then exceed the amount of purchases permitted for this buyer, then `purchaseLimitExceeded` will return as `true`. Thus function is not available to the buyer. You specify the member ID for the buyer whose order should be previewed. To get a general price preview for a plan that's not buyer-specific, use the [`getPricePreview()`](#getpricepreview) function.

docs.summary: Retrieves a preview of an order's pricing as if it was purchased.
description:
The `getPricePreview()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a temporary preview of the order's price.

The price preview uses the same logic for calculating prices as used when purchasing a plan, but the preview is not saved. If [taxes are configured](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-setting-up-tax-collection) for the site, taxes are applied to the preview. If not, the `tax` previews as `null`.

Buyers do not have to be logged in to preview the price, as such, the details returned by this function are not buyer-specific. To generate a preview of a purchase for a specific-buyer, use the [`getOfflineOrderPreview()`](#getofflineorderpreview).

params.name: _id
params.doc: Order ID.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the order is marked as paid.

docs.summary: Marks an offline order as paid.
description:
The `markAsPaid()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the offline order is successfully marked as paid.

The entire order is marked as paid, even if the order's payments are recurring.

>**Note:** Marking separate payment cycles as paid is not yet supported. Subsequent offline payments do trigger events and emails, but are not registered as additional offline payments.

Marking an offline order as paid causes the following changes:
- The order's `lastPaymentStatus` changes to `"PAID"`.
- The order's status changes to either `"PENDING"` or `"ACTIVE"`, depending on the order's `startDate`.

An error occurs if you attempt to:
- Mark an already-paid, offline order as paid. You cannot make an offline order as paid twice.
- Mark an online order as paid. The `markAsPaid()` function is supported for offline orders only.

examples.title: Resume paused orders by a member

extra.description: Page code provides button list of active orders for a logged-in member. Member selects paused plan and submits `#resumeOrderBtn` to resume the order. `#orderSelection` and `resumeOrderBtn` are initially disabled.

params.name: _id
params.doc: Order ID.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the order is paused.

description:
The `pauseOrder()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the order is successfully paused.

For orders with recurring payments, `pauseOrder()` also pauses the payment schedule. Buyers are not charged when an order is paused. Use `pauseOrder()`, for example, if the buyer is away and would like to put their pricing plan membership on hold until they return. Pausing an order affects the end date of the order by adding the time the order is paused to the `endDate`. You can only pause orders with an `"ACTIVE`" status.

Pausing an order causes the following changes:
- The order status changes to `"PAUSED"`.
- The `pausePeriods` array is updated.

The `endDate` and the `earliestEndDate` for the order are adjusted to include the pause period when the order is resumed.

Paused orders can be continued with the [`resumeOrder()`](#resumeorder) function.

Pause a pricing plan order (export from backend code)

body: // Disabe UI elements on page load

extra.description: This example provides a dropdown list of active orders for a logged-in member. The member selects a plan from the `#ordersDropdown` and clicks the `#cancelOrderBtn` to cancel the plan or the `#pauseOrderBtn` to pause the plan.

params.name: _id
params.doc: Order ID.

params.name: endDate
params.doc:
New end date and time.

Must be later than the current end date and time.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the order's end date has been postponed or made earlier.

docs.summary: Extends the duration of a pricing plan order by postponing the order's `endDate`.
description:
The `postponeEndDate()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the order's end date is successfully changed.

The new end date and time must be later than the order's current `endDate`.

Postponing the end date of an order does not impact payments. For example, if the pricing plan is for a membership to an online lecture series, and you want to extend the duration of the series because the lecturer could not attend some sessions, you can postpone the end date of the orders for all relevant participants. The participants will not be billed additionally.

Postponing an order causes the following changes:
- The `endDate` for the order is adjusted to the new end date.

Postpone an order's end date (export from backend code)
body: export const myPostponeEndDateFunction = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (_id, endDate) => {

params.name: _id
params.doc: Order ID.

params.name: effectiveAt
params.doc:
Whether to cancel the order immediately or at the next payment date.
One-time payment orders can only be canceled immediately.

Supported values:
- `"IMMEDIATELY"`: Indicates that the order should be canceled immediately.
- `"NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE"`: Indicates that the order be canceled at the next payment date.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the cancellation process is started.

docs.summary: Starts the process of canceling an order.
description:
The `requestCancellation()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the order cancellation is successfully requested.

For orders with recurring payments, a cancellation can be set to occur either immediately or at the next payment date. For orders with one-time payments, a cancellation occurs immediately after the request is processed.

Requesting an order cancellation starts the cancellation process. There may be some operations that continue to be processed before the status of the order is changed to `"CANCELED"`. For example, payments might need to be refunded before the order is fully canceled.

body: // Disabe UI elements on page load

extra.description: This example provides a dropdown list of active orders for a logged-in member. The member selects a plan from the `#ordersDropdown` and clicks the `#cancelOrderBtn` to cancel the plan or the `#pauseOrderBtn` to pause the plan.

params.name: _id
params.doc: Order ID.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the order is resumed.

docs.summary: Resumes a paused pricing plan order.
description:
The `resumeOrder()` function returns a Promise that resolves when a paused order is successfully resumed.

For orders with recurring payments, `resumeOrder()` also restarts the payment schedule.

Resuming an order causes the following changes:
- The order status changes to `"ACTIVE"`.
- The `pausePeriods` array is updated.
- The `endDate` for the order is adjusted to include the pause period.
- The `earliestEndDate` is adjusted to include the pause period. (This property is reserved for future use).

members.name: _id

members.name: effectiveAt
members.doc:
When the order is canceled.

One time orders can only be canceled immediately. Supported values:
- `"IMMEDIATELY"`: The order is canceled immediately.
- `"NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE"`: The order is canceled at the next payment date.

members.name: cause
members.doc:
Reason for the cancellation. One of:
+ `OWNER_ACTION`: Site owner canceled the order.
+ `MEMBER_ACTION`: Buyer initiated the cancellation.
+ `PAYMENT_FAILURE`: Payment transaction failed.
+ `PAYMENT_SETUP_FAILURE`: Buyer's payment details weren't set up correctly.
+ `UNKNOWN`: Reason for the cancellation is unknown.

members.name: effectiveAt
members.doc:
When the cancellation takes effect. Set when cancelling the order. One of:
+ `IMMEDIATELY`: Cancellation occurs immediately and the buyer can no longer use the plan.
+ `NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE`: Cancellation occurs at the next payment date and time. Buyer can continue to use the plan until that date and time.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: count
members.doc:
The amount of a duration `unit` in a single payment cycle.

Currently limited to support only `1`.

members.name: unit
members.doc: Unit of time for the cycle duration.

description: A duration expressed in number of time units.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: autoRenewCanceled
members.doc: Filter by whether or not the auto-renewal of recurring orders was canceled.

members.name: buyerIds
members.doc: Filter by a buyer's member ID. See [Members to learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members).

members.name: fieldSet
members.doc: Parameter to define amount of fields to return. FULL returns each order's submission data. Supported values: UNKNOWN_SET, BASIC, FULL

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of orders to return. See [Pagination](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/sorting-and-paging#getting-started_sorting-and-paging_paging) for more information.

Max: `50`

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of orders to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: orderStatuses
members.doc: Filter by order status.

members.name: paymentStatuses
members.doc: Filter by payment status.

members.name: planIds
members.doc: Filter by plan IDs. See [Plans to learn more about pricing plans](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-pricing-plans/pricing-plans/plans).

members.name: sorting
members.doc:
Sort order.

Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order.

Default: `DESC`

members.name: orders
members.doc: List of orders.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Object containing paging-related data (number of orders returned, offset).

members.name: fieldSet
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'BASIC'`
- `'FULL'`
- `'UNKNOWN_SET'`

members.name: autoRenewCanceled
members.doc: Filter by whether or not the auto-renewal of recurring orders was canceled.

members.name: buyerIds
members.doc: Filter by specific member IDs of buyers who ordered a pricing plan.

members.name: fieldSet
members.doc: Parameter to define amount of fields to return. FULL returns each order's submission data. Supported values: UNKNOWN_SET, BASIC, FULL

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of pricing plan orders to return.

Default: `50`

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of orders to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: orderStatuses
members.doc:
Filter by the order status. Supported values:
+ `DRAFT`: Order has been initiated but payment hasn't been processed yet. The plan isn't yet available for use to the buyer.
+ `PENDING`: Order has been purchased and its start date is set in the future.
+ `ACTIVE`: Order has been processed. The plan is available for use.
+ `PAUSED`: Order, and use of the plan, is [paused](#pauseorder). The order, and use of the plan, can be [resumed](#resumeorder).
+ `ENDED`: Order has completed its duration and is no longer available for use.
+ `CANCELED`: Order has been [canceled](#cancelorder).

members.name: paymentStatuses
members.doc:
Filter by payment status.

Supported values:
+ `PAID`: The last payment was paid.
+ `REFUNDED`: The last payment was refunded.
+ `FAILED`: The last payment transaction didn't complete.
+ `UNPAID`: The last payment wasn't paid.
+ `PENDING`: Awaiting payment.
+ `NOT_APPLICABLE`: No payment was necessary. For example, for free plans or free trials.

members.name: planIds
members.doc: Filter by specific IDs of plans that were ordered.

members.name: sorting
members.doc:
Sort order.

Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order.

Default: `DESC`

members.name: query
members.doc: [See available fields here](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/pricing-plans/pricing-plans/order-v2/filter-and-sort).

members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: fieldSet
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'BASIC'`
- `'FULL'`
- `'UNKNOWN_SET'`

members.name: _id
members.doc: Order ID.

Supported values:
- `'BASIC'`
- `'FULL'`
- `'UNKNOWN_SET'`

members.name: order
members.doc: Requested order.

members.name: autoRenewCanceled
members.doc: Filter for orders where auto renewal was canceled.

members.name: fieldSet
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'BASIC'`
- `'FULL'`
- `'UNKNOWN_SET'`

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of pricing plan orders to return.

Default: `50`

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of orders to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: orderStatuses
members.doc:
Filter by the order status. Supported values:
+ `DRAFT`: Order has been initiated but payment hasn't been processed yet. The plan isn't yet available for use to the buyer.
+ `PENDING`: Order has been purchased and its start date is set in the future.
+ `ACTIVE`: Order has been processed. The plan is available for use.
+ `PAUSED`: Order, and use of the plan, is [paused](#pauseorder). The order, and use of the plan, can be [resumed](#resumeorder).
+ `ENDED`: Order has completed its duration and is no longer available for use.
+ `CANCELED`: Order has been [canceled](#cancelorder).

members.name: paymentStatuses
members.doc:
Key Path to edit
ManagementListOrdersOptions.paymentStatuses
Production value
Filter by payment status.
Override
Filter by payment status.

Supported values:
+ `PAID`: The last payment was paid.
+ `REFUNDED`: The last payment was refunded.
+ `FAILED`: The last payment transaction didn't complete.
+ `UNPAID`: The last payment wasn't paid.
+ `PENDING`: Awaiting payment.
+ `NOT_APPLICABLE`: No payment was necessary. For example, for free plans or free trials.
Mark down view
Filter by payment status.

Supported values:

PAID: The last payment was paid.
REFUNDED: The last payment was refunded.
FAILED: The last payment transaction didn't complete.
UNPAID: The last payment wasn't paid.
PENDING: Awaiting payment.
NOT_APPLICABLE: No payment was necessary. For example, for free plans or free trials.

members.name: planIds
members.doc: Filter by plan IDs.

members.name: sorting
members.doc:
Sort order.

Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order.

Default: `ASC`

members.name: autoRenewCanceled
members.doc: Filter for orders where auto renewal was canceled.

members.name: fieldSet
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'BASIC'`
- `'FULL'`
- `'UNKNOWN_SET'`

members.name: limit
members.doc: Limit the number of pricing plans returned. Default limit is 50.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of entries to offset.

members.name: orderStatuses
members.doc: Filter by order status.

members.name: paymentStatuses
members.doc: Filter by payment status.

members.name: planIds
members.doc: Filter by plan IDs.

members.name: sorting
members.doc: Sorting direction (defaults to ASC) and field to sort by. [See available fields here](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/pricing-plans/pricing-plans/order-v2/filter-and-sort).

members.name: orders
members.doc: List of orders.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Object containing paging-related data (number of orders returned, offset).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID.

members.name: orderMethod
members.doc: Method by which checkout is initiated on buyer's behalf

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the order was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the order was updated.

members.name: autoRenewCanceled
members.doc:
Whether the order will be canceled at the next payment date.

If `true`, the order status will be `CANCELED` and the next payment won't be charged. Omitted for single payment orders.

members.name: buyer
members.doc:
The buyer's IDs. Includes `memberId` and `contactId`.

Currently, Pricing Plan purchases are limited to members only. `contactId` is returned,
but a buyer will not be able to purchase a plan without a `memberId`.

members.name: cancellation
members.doc:
Details about the cancellation of an order.

Only present if the status is `CANCELED`.

members.name: currentCycle
members.doc:
Current payment cycle for the order.

`currentCycle` will be omitted if the order's status is `CANCELED` or `ENDED`, or if the `startDate` hasn't passed yet.

members.name: earliestEndDate
members.doc:
Earliest end date and time that the plan for the order can expire.

Calculated by using the original end date plus any pause periods. Omitted if the order is active until canceled. Reserved for future use.

members.name: endDate
members.doc:
Current end date and time for the ordered plan.

`endDate` may be updated over the course of an order. If the order is [paused](#pauseorder),
it will have a later `endDate` once it [resumes](#resumeorder). `endDate` may also be [postponed](#postponeenddate).

Omitted if the order is valid until canceled and still `ACTIVE`.

members.name: formData
members.doc: Information about the form submitted during the plan's checkout.

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc:
Free trial period for the order, in days.

Only available for recurring plans.

members.name: lastPaymentStatus
members.doc:
Status of the last payment for the order.
Updated automatically for online orders. Updated manually by the site owner for offline orders.

Supported values:
+ `PAID`: The last payment was paid.
+ `REFUNDED`: The last payment was refunded.
+ `FAILED`: The last payment transaction didn't complete.
+ `UNPAID`: The last payment wasn't paid.
+ `PENDING`: Awaiting payment.
+ `NOT_APPLICABLE`: No payment was necessary. For example, for free plans or free trials.

members.name: pausePeriods
members.doc: List of periods during which the order is paused.

members.name: planDescription
members.doc: Plan description at the time of purchase

members.name: planId
members.doc: ID of the plan purchased with the order.

members.name: planName
members.doc: Plan name at the time of purchase.

members.name: planPrice
members.doc: Plan price as it was at the moment of order creation.

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Pricing model, price, and payment schedule for the order.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time for the ordered plan.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the order. Supported values:
+ `DRAFT`: Order has been initiated but payment hasn't been processed yet. The plan isn't yet available for use to the buyer.
+ `PENDING`: Order has been purchased and its start date is set in the future.
+ `ACTIVE`: Order has been processed. The plan is available for use.
+ `PAUSED`: Order, and use of the plan, is [paused](#pauseorder). The order, and use of the plan, can be [resumed](#resumeorder).
+ `ENDED`: Order has completed its duration and is no longer available for use.
+ `CANCELED`: Order has been [canceled](#cancelorder).

members.name: subscriptionId
members.doc:
ID of the related Wix subscription.

Every pricing plan order corresponds to a Wix subscription, including orders for single payment plans. See a [Pricing Plans overview](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-an-overview#create-plans-to-suit-your-business).

members.name: type
members.doc:
How the order was processed. Supported values:
+ `"ONLINE"`: The buyer purchased the plan using the site.
+ `"OFFLINE"`: The buyer made a manual, offline purchase without using the site.

members.name: wixPayOrderId
members.doc:
Wix Pay order ID.

Provided by Wix whether the order is created online or offline. The field is omitted when the order is free.

description:
An order object includes all of the details related to the purchase of a Pricing Plan.
You can manage existing orders, create offline orders, and preview orders not yet purchased.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order that is canceled, effective at the end of the current payment cycle.

description: Emitted when a recurring order is canceled for the next payment cycle

members.name: order
members.doc: Canceled order.

description: Emitted when an order is canceled immediately or when cycle ends for an order with canceled auto renewal

members.name: endedDate
members.doc: End date and time for this order cycle.

members.name: index
members.doc:
Index of this cycle in the order.

`0` when order is in a free trial period. In all other cases, the index starts with `1`.

members.name: startedDate
members.doc: Start date and time for this order cycle.

description: Order cycle start and end dates take into account free trial days and suspensions

members.name: cycleNumber
members.doc: Number of the payment cycle will be 0 when the order is in the free trial period. In other cases, the cycle number starts from 1.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order whose new cycle started.

description: Triggered at the start of a new payment cycle for an existing order.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order whose `endDate` was postponed.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order that ended.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order that was marked as paid.

members.name: order
members.doc: Paused order.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order that was paid for. If a free or an offline order, the order that was created.

members.name: order
members.doc: Resumed order.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order whose `startDate` changed.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order that reached its `startDate`.

members.name: query
members.doc: [See available fields here](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/pricing-plans/pricing-plans/order-v2/filter-and-sort).

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging-related data (number of orders returned, offset).

members.name: plans
members.doc: Retrieved orders.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: pauseDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the pause period.

members.name: resumeDate
members.doc:
End date and time of the pause period.

Omitted while the pause period remains `ACTIVE`.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the pause period. Supported values:
+ `ACTIVE`: Status while the order is [paused](#pauseorder).
+ `ENDED`: Status when the order is [resumed](#resumeorder).

members.name: _id
members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: endDate
members.doc:
New end date and time.

Must be later than the current end date and time.

members.name: coupon
members.doc: Coupon applied to the order.

members.name: currency
members.doc:
Three-letter currency code in
[ISO-4217 alphabetic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) format.

members.name: discount
members.doc: Total discount applied to the order.

members.name: proration
members.doc: Price change after billing date was change and price was adjusted. Could be positive and negative values.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: Price of the order excluding tax, specified as a monetary amount. For example, `"9.99"`.

members.name: tax
members.doc:
Tax applied to the order.

Tax is only applied if the site [has it configured](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-setting-up-tax-collection).

members.name: total
members.doc:
Price after tax and discount is applied. Specified as a monetary amount, for example, `"13.98"`.

If no tax is applied, the amount is the same as `subtotal`.

members.name: coupon
members.doc: Coupon applied to the order. Empty means no coupon was applied.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: discount
members.doc: Total discount applied.

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: Free trial period for the order in days. Only available for recurring plans.

members.name: planPrice
members.doc: Plan price as it was at the moment of order creation.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: One-time payment. Order is valid for a specified duration.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: One-time payment. Order is valid until it is canceled.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Order has recurring payments.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: Price of the order excluding tax, specified as a monetary amount. for example, `"9.99"`.

members.name: tax
members.doc: Tax applied.

members.name: total
members.doc:
Price after tax and discount is applied, specified as a monetary amount. For example, `"13.98"`.

If no tax is applied, the amount is the same as `subtotal`.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: One-time payment. Order is valid for a specified duration.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: One-time payment. Order is valid until it is canceled.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Order has recurring payments.

members.name: cycleFrom
members.doc:
Price starts to apply with this cycle.

`1` is the first payment cycle for all pricing models.

members.name: numberOfCycles
members.doc:
Amount of cycles to apply price for.

For `subscription` pricing models with a finite number of cycles, the `numberOfCycles` is the same as `pricing.subscription.cycleCount`.

For `subscription` pricing models that are unlimited or until-canceled, the `numberOfCycles` is not returned.

For `singlePaymentForDuration` and `singlePaymentUnlimited` pricing models, the `numberOfCycles` is `1`.

members.name: prices
members.doc: Pricing details for all pricing models.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model for an order with a one-time payment and the order is valid for a specific amount of time.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model for an order with a one-time payment and the order is valid until canceled.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Pricing model for an order with recurring payment cycles.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model for an order with a one-time payment and the order is valid for a specific amount of time.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model for an order with a one-time payment and the order is valid until canceled.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Pricing model for an order with recurring payment cycles.

description:
TODO: Write orders filter and sort docs page
Retrieves a list of up to 1,000 orders, based on the provided paging, [sorting, and filtering](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/pricing-plans/pricing-plans/order-v2/filter-and-sort).

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging-related data (number of orders returned, offset).

members.name: plans
members.doc: Order data.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: cycleCount
members.doc:
Amount of payment cycles this subscription is valid for.

`0` for unlimited or until-canceled.

members.name: cycleDuration
members.doc: Length of one payment cycle.

description: An object specifying how often and for how long payments recur (may be forever).

members.name: _id
members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: effectiveAt
members.doc:
Whether to cancel the order immediately or at the next payment date.
One-time payment orders can only be canceled immediately.

Supported values:
- `"IMMEDIATELY"`: Indicates that the order should be canceled immediately.
- `"NEXT_PAYMENT_DATE"`: Indicates that the order be canceled at the next payment date.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: order
members.doc: Order with submission id

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: duration
members.doc:
Cycle duration to apply `price` for.

Use with all pricing models.
Can apply the same price to multiple payment cycles.

members.name: price
members.doc: Order price.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Total tax, specified as a monetary amount. For example, `"3.99"`.

members.name: includedInPrice
members.doc: Whether tax is included in the original price. When `false`, tax is added at checkout.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the tax. For example, VAT.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Tax rate percentage, as a number between 0 and 100. For example, a 7% tax rate is `"7.00"`.
